main event: On 24 October 1968, a civilian reported observing a light in the sky in Kalamazoo, Michigan.
interesting points: The object was described as being comparable to half the diameter of a dime held at arm's length., The color of the object changed from red to orange and it appeared to be dropping flaming material., The observation lasted between 3 to 5 minutes., The object eventually disappeared upward into the clouds., The report suggested that the sighting might have been a local phenomenon or possibly a weather balloon.
sighted object: a light changing colors in the sky
witness description: Civilian, 25 years old, psychologist for school system
